column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Ahmadinejad came to Columbia and brought that argument up .
#Text=Yeah , right .

#Text=So we have squandered our moral legitimacy , we have squandered the legitimacy of the whole international human rights regime post World War II , of democracy , and as I always tell my students , once you lose your credibility or people ’s respect for your integrity , it may not be irreparable , but it takes such a long time to restore that , and ultimately our national security depends on that .
#Text=So I ’m really fearful .

#Text=I ’m ultimately optimistic in the long run , but it ’s a longer run than it would have been pre-9/11 , and not because of the terrorist attacks , but because of our reaction to the terrorist attacks .

#Text=And the use of that to get us into Iraq , and the erosion of trust — this is something Hagel was talking about — the erosion of trust toward government on the part of the American people , and particularly younger generations .
#Text=It was really corrosive .
#Text=It ’s surprising that Hagel gave that criticism since it is his party that has instituted the fear of government into our culture .
#Text=Such as Reagan ’s famous line that the most terrifying words in the English language are , “ I ’m from the government and I ’m here to help . ”
#Text=These parties are so heterogeneous , believe me , I would not want to be associated with a single one .
#Text=Even the ACLU does things I personally disagree with , so I would not want guilt by association .
#Text=If the party platform reflected [ Hagel ’s ] views , it would be a different party than it is now .
#Text=When I interviewed Gay Talese , I asked him how the Iraq War affected him and he said it had not .
#Text=He said , “ I wish it did ! ”
#Text=He said he does n’t feel anything and that he does n’t think anyone else does , either .
#Text=He feels you ca n’t have a war affect people unless you have conscription .
#Text=I totally agree with that , I completely agree with that .
#Text=Charlie Rangel , as you probably know , I completely agree with that .

#Text=The ACLU has always opposed the draft , going back to our founding , as in our view being inconsistent with the Thirteenth Amendment of involuntary servitude , but our fall-back position has always been , having lost on that argument , that if you are going to have a draft then it may not be discriminatory ; it should apply to women as well as men .
#Text=We took that case to the Supreme Court .

#Text=You ca n’t have exemptions for students and others who are privileged , and partly because that ’s consistent with Equal Protection guarantees , but that means that the way to enforce fairness : everybody has to be treated equally .

#Text=To have members of Congress and the Executive Branch send other people ’s kids off to war , or other people ’s spouses , they are not making a responsible decision if they do not have to feel the cost .
#Text=I could not agree with that more strongly .
#Text=The result might be then we would then have no war .
#Text=It ’s the same thing with all the deprivations of liberty in the war on terror , if I may say so .
#Text=All those surveys that say , “ Are you willing to give up freedom to enhance national security ? ”
#Text=The reason people say yes is they are willing to give up somebody ELSE’S freedom .
#Text=Okay , so take it away from the Muslims …
